level.heading: REQUIREMENTS FOR PHYSICAL THERAPISTS TO PERFORM INTRAMUSCULAR MANUAL THERAPY (§7-6716) Intramuscular manual therapy may be performed by a licensed physical therapistho meets the requirements of this section. Intramuscular manual therapy shall be performed directly by the licensedhysical therapist and shall not be delegated. Intramuscular manual therapy shall be performed in a manner that is consistentith generally accepted standards of practice, including clean needleechniques, and other applicable standards of the Centers for Disease Controlnd Prevention. Intramuscular manual therapy is an advanced procedure that requires specializedraining. A physical therapist shall only perform intramuscular manual therapy followingn examination and diagnosis, and for the purpose of treating specific anatomic entities selected according to physical signs. A physical therapist who performs intramuscular manual therapy shall obtainritten informed consent from each patient who will receive intramuscular manualherapy before the physical therapist performs intramuscular manual therapy onhe patient. The informed consent form shall include, at a minimum, the following: The patient’s signature; The risks and benefits of intramuscular manual therapy; The physical therapist’s level of education and training in intramuscularanual therapy; and A clearly and conspicuously written statement that the patient is not receivingcupuncture. A physical therapist who performs intramuscular manual therapy shall maintain aeparate procedure note in the patient’s chart for each intramuscular manualherapy.
